page.title: 05The Grand Union Canal
page.content: The northern part of this grid contains a portion of the Grand Union Canal which was built to link Leicester with London. In doing so it would link up with the celebrated "X" System invisiged by the great canal engineer James Brindley. This was designed to link the ports of Liverpool,Bristol,Hull and London, so by using this canal the Kilby area is still linked to these ports. The only traffic on this canal today is part of the leisure industry,indeed it is still heavily used by pleasure craft. Local people use the canal for recreational purposes especially dog walking and fishing. The canal is kept in good repair,painting work having recently been done. The canal provides good views over the rolling fields towards Kilby. The block contains five sets of locks.
